text:
Summary says it. This seems to be a problem specifically with 1.6, it works fine
with 1.5. I am reporting this for a friend.

build.xml:1: The processing instruction target matching "[xX][mM][lL]" is not
allowed.

This was stumbled upon from a copy paste from a web site to a build.xml file, it
introduced a space as the first character in the file.

At one point, you could say it makes you make nice XML files, as another point,
it is against the standard right?

I am not sure if this is against the XML spec or not. I think it is definetly 
the case that the parser will do only limited lookahead to find the <?xml ...?>
tag, since it needs to inspect it to find the encoding of the file and then it 
needs to restart reading using the proper encoding. So I do not think the spec 
allows putting an undetermined amount of white chars before the tag.
creator: j_a_fernandez@yahoo.com

text:
You cannot have a space in front of the optional <?xml?> instruction in an
xml file - this is reported both xerces and crimson.
